name: chronic eosinophilic leukemia
definition: A chronic leukemia characterized by a clonal proliferation of eosinophilic precursors resulting in persistently increased numbers of eosinophils in the blood, marrow and peripheral tissues. [url:https\://ghr.nlm.nih.gov/condition/pdgfra-associated-chronic-eosinophilic-leukemia, url:https\://www.cancer.gov/publications/dictionaries/cancer-terms/def/chronic-eosinophilic-leukemia]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with chronic eosinophilic leukemia harboring PCM1-JAK2 demonstrated complete clinical remission and decreased fusion transcript levels when treated with Jakafi (ruxolitinib) (PMID: 23630205).

references.title: Efficacy of ruxolitinib in chronic eosinophilic leukemia associated with a PCM1-JAK2 fusion gene.

clinicalTrials.title: Ruxolitinib in Treating Patients With Hypereosinophilic Syndrome or Primary Eosinophilic Disorders
Azacitidine, Venetoclax, and Pevonedistat in Treating Patients With Newly Diagnosed Acute Myeloid Leukemia
